content: laine french noun feminine /lɛn/ - wool do you ever throw on a pair of leggings and find yourself wondering if they re a bit sheer are you concerned that the cropped styles of the current 90 s fashion revival leave your lower half very exposed to the elements do you want another layer between your backside and the seats of your chosen mode of public transportation do you like clothing that is edgy chic and versatile if you answered yes to any of these questions may i present laine on the butt this sophisticated skirt is quick and easy to make and is suitable for a relative beginner it is seamless and requires only a knowledge of how to knit and purl and use a cable needle the sizing is very forgiving and customizable so it makes a great gift and since two garments are always better than one it does double-duty as an elegant bulky cowl so what are you waiting for get your knit together and cast on yarn 2-3 skeins 250-375m/272-408 yds of diamond luxury traditional chunky 125m/136yds per 100g or any similar weight worsted yarn colourway pictured is 1803 needles a 24in 5mm cable needle us 8 a 24in 6mm cable needle us 10 or sizes to obtain gauge other handy items a craft needle for weaving in yarn ends and a measuring tape gauge 15 sts and 18 row per 4in 10cm square sizing please note that this skirt is quite stretchy and is designed to have some negative ease aka cling the size chart below represents the finished measurements of the skirt itself but it will stretch 4-5 inches horizontally to accommodate a larger body measurement if you wish to wear it only as a cowl the extra small size will fit as shown in the photos the larger sizes will make lovely longer draped cowls when in doubt swatch swatch swatch xs waist 25in/63cm hip 30in/76cm length 17in/43cm s waist 28in/71cm hip 34in/86cm length 17in/43cm m waist 32in/81cm hip 38in/96cm length 17in/43cm l waist 35in/89cm hip 42in/106cm length 18in/46cm xl waist 38in/96cm hip 46in/116cm length 18in/46cm
